text: Say I have a 2D array (ie, a matrix). How can I reverse it by rows?

elements.text: Say I have a 2D array (ie, a matrix). How can I reverse it by rows?

text:
I get the following. The first method should match, no?
```julia> b
7×2 Array{Int64,2}:
....
julia> reverse(b, 1)
ERROR: MethodError: no method matching reverse(::Array{Int64,2}, ::Int64)
Closest candidates are:
  reverse(::Array{T,N} where N; dims) where T at arraymath.jl:61
  reverse(::AbstractArray{T,1} where T, ::Any) at array.jl:1592
  reverse(::AbstractArray{T,1} where T, ::Any, ::Any) at array.jl:1592```

elements.text: I get the following. The first method should match, no?

julia> b
7×2 Array{Int64,2}:
....
julia> reverse(b, 1)
ERROR: MethodError: no method matching reverse(::Array{Int64,2}, ::Int64)
Closest candidates are:
  reverse(::Array{T,N} where N; dims) where T at arraymath.jl:61
  reverse(::AbstractArray{T,1} where T, ::Any) at array.jl:1592
  reverse(::AbstractArray{T,1} where T, ::Any, ::Any) at array.jl:1592

text: Ah, its a keyword arg `reverse(b, dims=1)`
